label: WTE
info_overview:
WiDom Smart TE Dimmer is an "in-wall device" that controls the luminosity level and/or fan speed. A universal device that controls the light intensity of all types of dimmable lights, including LED lamps and energy-saving lamps. The Smart TE Dimmer includes the ON / OFF control option of non-dimmable loads. 

WiDom Smart TE Dimmer is very easy to install and works with both momentary and toggle switches.  

It operates in any Z-Wave network with other Z-Wave/Z-Wave Plus certified devices and controllers from any other manufacturer. As a constantly powered node, WiDom Smart TE Dimmer will act as repeater regardless of the vendor in order to increase the reliability of the network.
info_inclusion:
WiDom Smart TE Dimmer is compatible with all Z-Wave/Z-Wave Plus certified controllers. The device supports both the Network Wide Inclusion mechanism (which offers the ability to be included in a network, even if the device is not directly connected to the controller) and Normal Inclusion. By default, the inclusion procedure starts in Normal Inclusion mode and after a short timeout the procedure continues in Network Wide Inclusion mode that lasts for about 20 Seconds.

Before including the device the LED status indicator is solid RED. The procedure of inclusion is activated by clicking Add in the inclusion interface and by pressing any sequence of click on the integrated button. As soon as the inclusion procedure initiates the LED indicator starts a sequence of GREEN-BLUE blinks. The device is included in the network when the LED status is OFF and the interview is completed.
info_exclusion: Only a controller can remove the device from the network. After activating the exclusion function by the controller, the device can be removed by setting it in Learning Mode. If you are using the WiDom Multi Sensor Room Controller, the procedure of exclusion can be activated by Removing a node from the Z-Wave network and any click sequence on the integrated button; as soon as the exclusion initiates, the LED indicator starts a sequence of RED-BLUE blinks. The device is excluded from the network when the LED status indicator is solid RED and the App_status in the interface is OK.
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Start-up status
parameters.description: Defines the status of the device, in term of light level, following a restart.

parameters.label: Fade On Time
parameters.description: Defines the time spent to switch the load from complete OFF to complete ON

parameters.label: Fade Off Time
parameters.description: Defines the time spent to switch the load from complete ON to complete OFF

parameters.label: Local Dimming Time
parameters.description: Defines the time spent to switch the controlled load
parameters.overview: Defines the time spent to switch the controlled load when the external switch is hold down

parameters.label: Minimum Light Level
parameters.description: Defines which light level will correspond to 1% in the range between 1 and 98%

parameters.label: Maximum Light Level
parameters.description: Defines which light level will correspond to 99% in the range between 2 and 99%

parameters.label: Dimmable Load
parameters.description: Define if the connected loads are dimmable or not

options.label: NON_DIMMABLE_LOAD
options.overview: Any dim level value greater than 0 will set the load to full load. Fade On and Fade Off are considered as 0 seconds

options.label: DIMMABLE LOAD
options.overview: The load can be controlled as dimmable load

parameters.label: Type of external switch
parameters.description: Defines the type of external switch connected to the device

options.label: IGNORE
options.overview: The actions on the external switch are ignored. In this mode, the device can only be controlled through the network.

options.label: BUTTON
options.overview: The external switch is a momentary switch type

options.label: SWITCH
options.overview: The external switch is a traditional switch (toggle switch)

associations.label: Dimming
associations.overview: The 2nd association group allows to propagate the status of the controller device to its associated devices. The devices of the 2nd association group will receive a “Start level change” command by pressing the external switch of the dimmer (controller device), and a “Stop level change” command when the switch is released.  The “Start level change” also sets the dimming duration and start level for the controlled devices by propagating its local diming time and its current value.

xml.xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Product>
    <Model>WTE</Model>
    <Label lang="en">Widom Smart Dimmer</Label>

    <CommandClasses>
        <Class>
            <id>0x20</id>             <!-- BASIC -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x25</id>             <!-- SWITCH_BINARY -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x32</id>             <!-- METER -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x59</id>             <!-- ASSOCIATION_GROUP_INFO -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x5A</id>             <!-- DEVICE_RESET_LOCALLY -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x5E</id>             <!-- ZWAVE_PLUS_INFO -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x60</id>             <!-- MULTI_INSTANCE -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x70</id>             <!-- CONFIGURATION -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x72</id>             <!-- MANUFACTURER_SPECIFIC -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x73</id>             <!-- POWERLEVEL -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x7A</id>             <!-- FIRMWARE_UPDATE_MD -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x85</id>             <!-- ASSOCIATION -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x86</id>             <!-- VERSION -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x8E</id>             <!-- MULTI_INSTANCE_ASSOCIATION -->
        </Class>
        <Class>
            <id>0x98</id>             <!-- SECURITY -->
        </Class>
    </CommandClasses>

    <Configuration>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>1</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Start-up status</Label>
            <Type>short</Type>
            <Default>-1</Default>
            <Minimum>-1</Minimum>
            <Maximum>99</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines the status of the device, in term of light level, following a restart.
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>2</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Fade On Time</Label>
            <Type>Fade On Time </Type>
            <Default>1</Default>
            <Minimum>-126</Minimum>
            <Maximum>126</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines the time spent to switch the load from complete OFF to complete ON
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>3</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Fade Off Time</Label>
            <Type>short</Type>
            <Default>1</Default>
            <Minimum>-126</Minimum>
            <Maximum>126</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines the time spent to switch the load from complete ON to complete OFF
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>4</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Local Dimming Time</Label>
            <Type>short</Type>
            <Default>5</Default>
            <Minimum>1</Minimum>
            <Maximum>60</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines the time spent to switch the controlled load when the external switch is hold down
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>10</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Minimum Light Level</Label>
            <Type>short</Type>
            <Default>1</Default>
            <Minimum>1</Minimum>
            <Maximum>98</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines which light level will correspond to 1% in the range between 1 and 98%
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

		<Parameter>
            <Index>11</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Maximum Light Level</Label>
            <Type>short</Type>
            <Default>99</Default>
            <Minimum>2</Minimum>
            <Maximum>99</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines which light level will correspond to 99% in the range between 2 and 99%
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>20</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Dimmable Load</Label>
            <Type>list</Type>
            <Default>1</Default>
            <Minimum>0</Minimum>
            <Maximum>1</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Item>
                <Value>0</Value>
                <Label lang="en">NON DIMMABLE LOAD/Label>
            </Item>
            <Item>
                <Value>1</Value>
                <Label lang="en">DIMMABLE LOAD</Label>
            </Item>
            <Help><![CDATA[Define if the connected loads are dimmable or not
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

        <Parameter>
            <Index>62</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Type of external switch</Label>
            <Type>list</Type>
            <Default>1</Default>
            <Minimum>0</Minimum>
            <Maximum>2</Maximum>
            <Size>1</Size>
            <Item>
                <Value>0</Value>
                <Label lang="en">IGNORE</Label>
            </Item>
            <Item>
                <Value>1</Value>
                <Label lang="en">BUTTON</Label>
            </Item>
            <Item>
                <Value>2</Value>
                <Label lang="en">SWITCH</Label>
            </Item>
            <Help><![CDATA[Defines the type of external switch connected to the device
            ]]></Help>
        </Parameter>

    </Configuration>

    <Associations>

        <Group>
            <Index>1</Index>
            <Label lang="en">Lifeline</Label>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
            <SetToController>true</SetToController>
        </Group>

        <Group>
            <Index>2</Index>
            <Label lang="en">1 click Button S1</Label>
            <Maximum>8</Maximum>
        </Group>

    </Associations>

</Product>
